comment.author: 54403180@N04
comment._content:
Thanks for your question, ibrghtskr1. 

PRONI also have some of the business records from the Allison Photographic Studios in Armagh and often, although not always, we can match the number which is on the original glass plate negative to an entry in a Day Book - which gives details of the patron: their family name, sometimes (unfortunately not always) their address, the date and details of the prints that they ordered. 
For this photo all we know is that it was taken for a family named Wright of Aughnacloy in County Tyrone on the 20th June 1928.

You can find this information under each image. 

We would, of course, be delighted if anyone can identify the sitters in any of the photos by name!

I hope this is helpful.
comment.authorname: Public Record Office of Northern Ireland
